title: Spaceborne Computer-2 completes 24 experiments on ISS
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Microsoft and NASA will share details at the 37th Space Symposium on 24 research experiments completed to date on the International Space Station’s HPE Spaceborne Computer-2.

title: Telesat adjusts polar satellite design to tackle supply issues
summary: Telesat has upgraded a quarter of its planned low Earth orbit constellation as supply chain issues force it to consider ordering fewer satellites for the delayed broadband network.

title: Lockheed Martin releases open-source satellite interface for on-orbit docking
summary: Lockheed Martin on April 4 released the technical specifications of a docking adapter that could be used by manufacturers to make satellites interoperable and easier to update on orbit with new technology.

title: SpaceX’s second private Crew Dragon astronaut launch slips to April 8th
summary: SpaceX’s second private astronaut launch and the first fully private crewed mission to the International Space Station (ISS) has been delayed again,...

title: Telesat gets security clearance to serve US government directly
summary: Canada’s Telesat said April 4 it has gained the security clearances it needs to sell directly to U.S. government customers.
